resources.string: Application developed by José Carlos Manjón Carrasco Version 1.0

Red Pikmin are characterized by their scarlet-colored bodies and pointed noses. In addition to the plant traits typical of their species, they exhibit animal-like characteristics such as a strong fighting spirit and a high degree of curiosity. They have great adaptability, as they are not only resistant to extreme heat but also tend to inhabit a wide variety of ecosystems.

Purple Pikmin are characterized by their robust and resilient bodies. They are stronger and larger than the rest of their species. They weigh 10 times more than any other Pikmin. Like White Pikmin, they can only be born from bouncing sprouts found in underground regions, making them a unique species.

This type of Pikmin is characterized by its yellow body and a pair of lamellae resembling ears that allow them to dig quickly and reach great heights when thrown. Another distinguishing trait is their ability to conduct electricity. They are not only resistant to it but also seem to enjoy it.

Blue Pikmin are characterized by their blue-colored bodies and inscrutable facial expressions. Unlike most radiambulant species, which cannot breathe underwater, Blue Pikmin have gills that resemble a mouth. These gills allow them to survive in both aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems.

White Pikmin are characterized by their white bodies and red eyes. Their small bodies secrete a potent poison, which also makes them immune to certain toxins. White Pikmin seeds can be obtained through ivory bouncing sprouts that only grow in underground regions.
Rock Pikmin are a type of parasitic Pikmin called "Ermikmin" that use a stone as a host. Similar to a seed that takes root through cracks in a rock, the Pikmin’s roots penetrate the stone.
Winged Pikmin are characterized by their pink bodies and prominent blue eyes that resemble lenses. They move swiftly through the air with their wings, but their attacks do not cause much damage.

Glow Pikmin are characterized by their radiant green bodies. When the leaf on their head blooms, it takes the shape of a star. They have several traits that distinguish them from other types of Pikmin, one of which is that instead of sprouting from onions, they sprout from lumilomas found only at night and in underground regions.

This species has a scarlet abdomen speckled with white spots. Their habits are nocturnal, so during the day they are usually found sleeping. If awakened, they will attempt to devour anything in front of them. There is a wide variety of gusarapérrids, and they are considered to be at the top of the food chain.
